inference:
The area of the interior triangle is the sum of the areas of the three squares minus the area of the largest square:

$$\begin{align}
\text{Area of the interior triangle} &= (169+25+144) - 169\\
&= \boxed{209}.
\end{align}$$

Final Answer: \\boxed{$209$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Each leg of the right triangle is a side of one of the squares.  Therefore, the legs of the right triangle have lengths $\sqrt{25}=5$ and $\sqrt{144}=12$, so the area of the triangle is $\frac12(5)(12) = \boxed{30}$.
